verses.text: And it came to pass, when \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* was \w old|strong="H2204"\w*, that he \w made|strong="H7760"\w* his \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w judges|strong="H8199"\w* over \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

Now the \w name|strong="H8034"\w* of his \w firstborn|strong="H1121"\w* was \w Joel|strong="H3100"\w*; and the \w name|strong="H8034"\w* of his \w second|strong="H4932"\w*, \w Abiah|strong="H0029"\w*: \add they were\add* \w judges|strong="H8199"\w* in \w Beer-sheba|strong="H0884"\w*.

And his \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w walked|strong="H1980"\w* not in his \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*, but turned \w aside|strong="H5186"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* \w lucre|strong="H1215"\w*, and \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w bribes|strong="H7810"\w*, and \w perverted|strong="H5186"\w* \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*.

Then all the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* gathered themselves \w together|strong="H6908"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* unto \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w*,

And \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Behold, thou art \w old|strong="H2204"\w*, and thy \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w walk|strong="H1980"\w* not in thy \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*: now \w make|strong="H7760"\w* us a \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* us like all the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*.

¶ But the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* \w displeased|strong="H3415"\w* \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w*, when they \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Give|strong="H5414"\w* us a \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* us. And \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* \w prayed|strong="H6419"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 8.6 \ft displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w*, \w Hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* in all that they \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto thee: for they have not \w rejected|strong="H3988"\w* thee, but they have \w rejected|strong="H3988"\w* me, that I should not \w reign|strong="H4427"\w* over them.

According to all the \w works|strong="H4639"\w* which they have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* since the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* that I brought them \w up|strong="H5927"\w* out of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* even unto this \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, wherewith they have \w forsaken|strong="H5800"\w* me, and \w served|strong="H5647"\w* \w other|strong="H0312"\w* \w gods|strong="H0430"\w*, so \w do|strong="H6213"\w* they also unto thee.

Now therefore \w hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto their \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*: \w howbeit|strong="H0389"\w* yet \w protest|strong="H5749"\w* \w solemnly|strong="H5749"\w* unto them, and \w shew|strong="H5046"\w* them the \w manner|strong="H4941"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* that shall \w reign|strong="H4427"\w* over them.\f + \fr 8.9 \ft hearken…: or, obey\f*\f + \fr 8.9 \ft howbeit…: or, notwithstanding when thou hast solemnly protested against them then thou shalt\f*

¶ And \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* \w told|strong="H0559"\w* all the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \w asked|strong="H7592"\w* of him a \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, This will be the \w manner|strong="H4941"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* that shall \w reign|strong="H4427"\w* over you: He will \w take|strong="H3947"\w* your \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, and \w appoint|strong="H7760"\w* \add them\add* for himself, for his \w chariots|strong="H4818"\w*, and \add to be\add* his \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*; and \add some\add* shall \w run|strong="H7323"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* his \w chariots|strong="H4818"\w*.

And he will \w appoint|strong="H7760"\w* him \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* over \w thousands|strong="H0505"\w*, and \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* over \w fifties|strong="H2572"\w*; and \add will set them\add* to \w ear|strong="H2790"\w* his \w ground|strong="H2758"\w*, and to \w reap|strong="H7114"\w* his \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w*, and to \w make|strong="H6213"\w* his \w instruments|strong="H3627"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w instruments|strong="H3627"\w* of his \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*.

And he will \w take|strong="H3947"\w* your \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* \add to be\add* \w confectionaries|strong="H7548"\w*, and \add to be\add* \w cooks|strong="H2879"\w*, and \add to be\add* \w bakers|strong="H0644"\w*.

And he will \w take|strong="H3947"\w* your \w fields|strong="H7704"\w*, and your \w vineyards|strong="H3754"\w*, and your \w oliveyards|strong="H2132"\w*, \add even\add* the \w best|strong="H2896"\w* \add of them\add*, and \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \add them\add* to his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*.

And he will take the \w tenth|strong="H6237"\w* of your \w seed|strong="H2233"\w*, and of your \w vineyards|strong="H3754"\w*, and \w give|strong="H5414"\w* to his \w officers|strong="H5631"\w*, and to his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*.\f + \fr 8.15 \ft officers: Heb. eunuchs\f*

And he will \w take|strong="H3947"\w* your \w menservants|strong="H5650"\w*, and your \w maidservants|strong="H8198"\w*, and your \w goodliest|strong="H2896"\w* young \w men|strong="H0970"\w*, and your \w asses|strong="H2543"\w*, and \w put|strong="H6213"\w* \add them\add* to his \w work|strong="H4399"\w*.
He will take the \w tenth|strong="H6237"\w* of your \w sheep|strong="H6629"\w*: and ye shall be his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*.

And ye shall cry \w out|strong="H2199"\w* in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of your \w king|strong="H4428"\w* which ye shall have \w chosen|strong="H0977"\w* you; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will not \w hear|strong="H6030"\w* you in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*.

¶ Nevertheless the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w refused|strong="H3985"\w* to \w obey|strong="H8085"\w* the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w*; and they \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Nay; but we will have a \w king|strong="H4428"\w* over us;

That we also may be like all the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*; and that our \w king|strong="H4428"\w* may \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* us, and go \w out|strong="H3318"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* us, and \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* our \w battles|strong="H4421"\w*.

And \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* all the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and he \w rehearsed|strong="H1696"\w* them in the \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w*, \w Hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto their \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, and \w make|strong="H4427"\w* them a \w king|strong="H4428"\w*. And \w Samuel|strong="H8050"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* ye every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* unto his \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.
